body.p: Most of the respondents to the 2010 Hedge Accounting Exposure Draft agreed with the ‘insurance premium’ view. They thought that the proposal provided a better representation of the performance and effect of the entity’s risk management strategy than under IAS 39. In their view, the proposals alleviated undue profit or loss volatility and reflected the economic substance of the transaction. They also thought that the costs of hedging should be associated with the hedged item instead of being mischaracterised as hedge ineffectiveness.
